not_enough_disk.message: There is not enough disk space to update.

update_downloaded.message: Finished downloading update. Restart and install now?
update_downloaded.title: App Update

update_not_available.message: There are no updates currently available.

atlantis.header: Welcome to the SPIKE App 3 Beta
atlantis.text1: We are excited to invite you to join SPIKE App 3 Beta. In this Beta version, you will experience improved Bluetooth connection, motor performance, and a new Python API.
atlantis.text2: Please note that the Beta version is work in progress hence some exsisting features and content may not be available.
atlantis.text3: You need to use a USB cable to update your Hub OS for SPIKE App 3 Beta.

gecko.text: The SPIKE™ App requires access to Bluetooth to connect to the SPIKE Hub. To continue, please input the following sequence as numerical digits to confirm that you are over 18 years old or ask an adult for help if you are not:

browserDisclaimer.text:
Use Google Chrome to access the 
LEGO® Education SPIKE™ App.

browserSupport.featureIntro:
Your browser can’t run SPIKE App,
because it doesn’t support:
browserSupport.recommendation: We recommend using Google Chrome on Chromebook, Windows or macOS.

buildPage.noBuildingInstructions: Download one of the Units to get Building Instructions

closingWebAppDisclaimer.text: Download your projects before leaving to save your work.

confirmDialog.closeProjectWithoutSave: This project is not saved, are you sure you want to close it?

connecting.bluetooth_BLE: Turn on your Hub to activate Bluetooth
connecting.cable_connect: Use the USB cable to connect the Hub and device
connecting.cable_step1: 1. Insert the cable into the Hub.
connecting.cable_step2: 2. Insert the cable into the device.
connecting.rename_your_hub: Give your Hub a unique name.
connecting.title: Connect Hub

bluetooth.guide1: Press and hold to turn on your Hub

iPad.fallback: Having trouble connecting via Bluetooth? Use the USB cable to connect to a computer and try again.

essential.guide2: Press the button to turn on your Hub

usb.guide1: Use the USB cable to connect the Hub and device

connection.webGuide1: Open the Connection Window and find your Hub
connection.webGuide2: Find your Hub in the connection window
connection.webGuide3: Click on the Hub name, then click on ‘Pair’

gecko.text:
This is for grown-ups. You are about to leave the app.

To continue please input the following sequence as numerical digits and confirm that you are over 18 years old:
gecko.title: Wait...

coppaWarning.text: Before you proceed, we need to know if you are a teacher or student
coppaWarning.title: Wait...

dataProcessPolicy.text: We process non-identifiable information in order to provide a functioning experience in this application.

dataExceeded.importText: Your recorded data exceeds the maximum allowable size. Only the first entries were imported from the Hub.
dataExceeded.text: Your line graph data has exceeded the maximum allowable size. Clear the graph to add more data.
dataExceeded.title: Heads Up!

missingSteps.description: There are no steps on this activity
missingSteps.title: Steps missing

errors.program_memory_error: Not enough memory, you may be able to run in Streaming Mode.
errors.title: An error occurred

descriptions.bargraphmonitor: This extension allows you to display bar graphs
descriptions.breakout: Open the Ultrasonic Sensor to get access to the raw pins and connect non-LEGO motors and sensors.
descriptions.device: Play sounds from your computer’s speakers or control your model using your keyboard or microphone.
descriptions.displaymonitor: This extension allows you to display images or text
descriptions.flippermoremotor: Make motors hold their position or run motors with unregulated power.
descriptions.flippermoremove: Set the individual motor speed on a Driving Base or make it hold its position.
descriptions.flippermoresensors: This extension provides additional sensor data, such as acceleration and raw color readings.
descriptions.flippermusic:
Play instruments and drums. 
 Music will play from your computer or tablet.
descriptions.horizontalbargraphmonitor: Log and visualize data on a Bar Graph
descriptions.horizontaldisplaymonitor: This extension allows you to display images or text
descriptions.horizontalmove: Set the individual motor speed on a Driving Base or make it hold its position.
descriptions.linegraphmonitor: This extension allows you to display and experiment with line graphs.
descriptions.weather: Get this week's weather forecast. Your computer needs to be connected to the internet. Weather forecast from Yr, delivered by the Norwegian Meteorological Institute and NRK.

feedback.description: Open a feedback window to provide information about an app-related issue.

unknownFirmwareDialog.text: The Hub OS needs to be updated.
unknownFirmwareDialog.title: Update Hub

progress.battery-low: Battery is low, please plug-in your Hub first

dialog.text: Press and hold the Center Button for approximately 20 seconds until the Hub turns on.

toast.text: Hub OS update complete. Reconnect your Hub now.

progress.failure: An error occurred while updating the Hub OS
progress.failure-USB: If the problem persists use the USB cable to connect to a computer. Visit spike.legoeducation.com to update your Hub.
progress.failure-reconnect: An error occurred while updating the Hub OS. Please reconnect the Hub and try again.
progress.success-reconnect: The Hub OS has been updated. Please hold down the power button for 4 seconds and reconnect your Hub.
progress.success-turnOff: Press and hold to turn off your Hub

usbupdate.text: Hub OS needs to be updated. This update can only be done with a USB connection on a Windows or Mac device.

firmwareUpdate.downgradeNotification: Your Hub has been updated to a newer version than the app.
firmwareUpdate.mindstormsHub: This Hub cannot be used with the SPIKE app.

noUSB.body: The update needs a USB connection. Use the USB cable to connect the Hub and device and go to:
noUSB.text: If you have trouble connecting your Hub over Bluetooth, try to connect it to a device with a USB port using the USB cable and go to:
noUSB.title: Your Hub needs to be updated

firmwareUpdate.promptForUSB: Use the USB cable for a faster Hub OS Update

allDone.descriptionEssential: You've finished all tutorials and you're now ready to explore SPIKE Essential
allDone.descriptionPrime: You've finished all tutorials and you're now ready to explore SPIKE Prime
allDone.imageAltPrime: Two smiling LEGO Minifigures, one is waving
allDone.title: All done!

disconnect_guide.headline: Disconnect the Hub
disconnect_guide.text: Go to Settings on your device > Go to Bluetooth > Press the information icon next to the Hub > Press “Disconnect”

deleteModal.text: Deleting {{dataName}} will remove it from the Hub.
Deleting "{{programName}}" will remove it from the Hub.

host-popup.message: Please start the SPIKE app and refresh your browser
host-popup.title: No SPIKE app running

disclaimer.headline: Read this before you update!
disclaimer.text1: You are about to install a beta version of the Hub OS. This version will improve the Bluetooth connection and motor performance. However, not all previous functionalities are included.
disclaimer.text2: SPIKE App 3 is not compatible with SPIKE App 2.
disclaimer.text3: If you update and want to use SPIKE App 2 again, you need to downgrade the Hub OS.

atlantis.headline: There is a new Hub OS update.
atlantis.headline2: You might need to update your Hub OS
atlantis.text: What color is your Power Button?

disclaimer.text1: Your Hub OS needs to be updated to work with SPIKE App 3. Do you want to update your Hub OS now?
disclaimer.text2: Please note that updating will delete any programs stored on the Hub. Your updated Hub won't work with previous SPIKE App versions.
disclaimer.text3: If you want to connect an updated Hub using SPIKE Legacy App, ​you need to downgrade the Hub. The Hub downgrade tool is only available on macOS and ChromeOS.

footer.prepare: Go to the teacher preparation material.
footer.slide-1: Please confirm that you have everything you'll need to get the most out of SPIKE™ Prime.
footer.slide-2: Build your SPIKE™ Prime creation and connect it to your smart device.
footer.slide-3: Stack programming blocks to build your program.
footer.slide-4: Play your program to see if your SPIKE™ Prime creation works as you intended.

footer.slide-1: Please confirm that you have everything you'll need to get the most out of SPIKE™ Essential.
footer.slide-2: Build your SPIKE™ Essential creation and connect it to your smart device.
footer.slide-4: Play your program to see if your SPIKE™ Essential creation works as you intended.

unitplans.description: All of the SPIKE Prime lessons, grouped into themed units to actively engage middle school students in STEAM learning.

spike2.python: This project was made with SPIKE App 2. You’ll need to update the code to use the new Python modules to run it.

new-connection.long: Press the button and your Hub will be highlighted on the list of available Hubs

spike2.python: This project was made with SPIKE App 2. Unfortunately, it cannot be opened in SPIKE App 3.
spike2.wordblocks: This project was made with SPIKE App 2. It might work slightly different in SPIKE App 3.

deleteDialog.textPluralis: Are you sure you want to delete all of the selected projects?
deleteDialog.textSingular: Are you sure you want to delete the selected project?

body.allowBluetooth: Allow the SPIKE App to use Bluetooth in your device Settings. Bluetooth is needed to connect to your Hub.
body.allowMicrophone: Allow the SPIKE App to use Microphone in your device Settings. The Microphone is needed to use the loudness blocks and record sounds.
body.openingProjectMissingUnit:
The project your are trying to open is part of a Lesson. 
Download the Unit that contains the lesson before opening the project.

header.allowBluetooth: The SPIKE™ App would like to use Bluetooth
header.allowMicrophone: The SPIKE™ App would like to use the Microphone
header.openingProjectMissingUnit: This project is part of a Lesson

footer.slide-1: Apply the stickers to the sorting trays.
footer.slide-2: Open the bags and sort the bricks into the compartments.
footer.slide-3: Insert the Battery into the Hub.
footer.slide-4: Press the big button to turn the power on.
footer.slide-5: Label each Hub, motor, sensor, and box with a name or number.
footer.slide-6: All Hubs have a default program preinstalled, which is symbolized by a heart
footer.slide-7: Your Hub needs to be updated the first time you connect. This update can only be done with a USB connection on a Windows or Mac device.

troubleshooting.anotherUSB: If possible, try a different USB Cable or a different USB port

spike2.updatedToSpike3: Then your Hub OS is updated to use SPIKE App 3

troubleshooting.spikeUSB: Make sure you use the white USB cable from the SPIKE set
troubleshooting.turnOn: Make sure you turn on the Hub
troubleshooting.updateWithUSB: You need to update your Hub OS with the USB cable

unitplans.teacherSupport: VIEW LESSON PLANS AND TEACHER SUPPORT
unitplans.title: Unit Plans

disclaimer.text1: In SPIKE App 3 there are vast improvements to Bluetooth connectivity, support for bigger user programs, better motor performance, and much more.
disclaimer.text2: Please note that coding in Python or opening existing programs is not yet possible. To use Python or open saved programs created in a previous version of the SPIKE App, please use the SPIKE Legacy App.
disclaimer.text3: Are you ready to experience SPIKE App 3 or do you want to open the SPIKE Legacy App?

info.text: To open SPIKE App 2 projects or use Python, go to spikelegacy.legoeducation.com.

header.spike3-promotion: There is a new version of the SPIKE App

text.bluetooth: Making it faster to connect to your SPIKE Prime Hub over Bluetooth
text.firmwareAndMore: To get started update your Hub OS. Teachers are recommended to update all hubs with the USB cable prior to a lesson.
text.python: Making it easier to transition from Word Blocks to Python
text.pythonComing: A new Python API will be coming soon. Use the SPIKE Legacy app for Python until then.
text.spike3-promotion:
Update to SPIKE App 3 to get better Bluetooth connection for SPIKE Prime, and many other improvements.

To open existing programs or use Python, keep using the SPIKE Legacy App.

windowSizeDisclaimer.text: Make sure your window is at least 1024x768 pixels for the optimal experience.
